channel.title: Object giving item

item.title: Object giving item
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Your problem is you’re trying to give them the object based on the length of the fromObject array.
Java starts at 0, so you’d need to take 1 off of the length to get the index.

Read full topic

item.title: Object giving item
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

So basically what I want to happen is this.

public static int itemLoot[] = { 2460, 2462, 2464, 2466, 2468, 2470,
			2472, 2474, 2476 };
public static int[] fromObject = { 2980, 2981, 2982, 2983, 2984, 2985,
			2986, 2987, 2988 };

I want item object 2983 give the item 2466. I’ve done this before with methods as the following.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("checkarray")) {
			int [] a1 = { 1038, 1040, 1042, 1044, 1046, 1048 };
			String [] a2 = { "Red", "Yellow", "Blue", "Green", "Purple", "White" };
			for (int i = 0; i < a1.length; i++) {
				c.sendMessage(a2[i] + " Partyhat " + " - Id: " + a1[i] + ".");
			}
			
		}

My problem is, is that it is not giving me the item, except an exception in the JVM. Here is my add item code.

c.getItems().addItem(itemLoot[fromObject.length], 1);

JVM Error;

[5/13/15 4:40 PM]: A fatal exception has been thrown!
[5/13/15 4:40 PM]: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 9

How can i fix this, or am i just missing something?

Read full topic
